title: Network monitoring dashboard is slow
content:
Hi team,

I've been using your network monitoring tool for the past month, and I've noticed that the dashboard takes 15-20 seconds to load each time I refresh it. This is making it very difficult to monitor our network in real-time. We're a small business with about 50 devices, and this performance issue is really impacting our productivity.

Could you please look into this? We're running the latest version (2.3.1) on a dedicated server with 16GB RAM.

Thanks,
Sarah Johnson
IT Manager, TechStart Solutions
author: Sarah Johnson

title: Love the new VPN feature!
content:
Hello PlexNet team,

I just wanted to say how much I love the new VPN kill switch feature you added in the latest update. It's exactly what I needed for my work-from-home setup. The interface is intuitive and the performance is excellent. Keep up the great work!

One small suggestion: it would be nice to have a way to create custom VPN profiles for different networks (work vs personal).

Best regards,
Mike Chen
Network Engineer
author: Mike Chen

title: Critical: Cannot access dashboard after update
content:
URGENT: Dashboard completely inaccessible

After installing the latest update (2.3.2), I cannot log into the dashboard at all. Getting a 'Connection timeout' error. This is affecting our entire network monitoring setup for our data center with 200+ servers.

Please provide immediate assistance as this is causing significant downtime.

System details:
- PlexNet version: 2.3.2
- OS: Ubuntu Server 22.04
- Browser: Chrome 120.0.6099.109
- Network: Corporate LAN

Error message: 'Failed to establish connection to monitoring service'

This is blocking our entire operations team. Please respond ASAP.

Regards,
David Rodriguez
Infrastructure Manager
GlobalTech Enterprises
author: David Rodriguez

metadata.subject: CRITICAL: Dashboard Login Failure After Update 2.3.2

title: Feature request: API access for automation
content:
Hi there,

We're a managed service provider and we're very interested in integrating PlexNet into our client management platform. Currently, we're manually checking dashboards for each client, which is time-consuming.

Could you please provide information about:
1. REST API availability for programmatic access to monitoring data
2. Webhook support for real-time alerts
3. Bulk device management APIs

We're managing networks for 50+ clients and API integration would significantly improve our efficiency.

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Jennifer Liu
Technical Account Manager
NetOps Solutions Inc.
author: Jennifer Liu

metadata.subject: API Integration Inquiry for MSP Use Case

title: Documentation improvement suggestions
content:
Hello PlexNet documentation team,

I've been setting up PlexNet for our organization and found several areas where the documentation could be improved:

1. The VPN configuration guide doesn't mention firewall port requirements
2. Wireless network monitoring setup lacks troubleshooting steps for common issues
3. API documentation examples are incomplete for authentication flows
4. Mobile app setup instructions are outdated

We're a university network team managing 500+ access points and good documentation is crucial for our deployment.

I've attached some screenshots of confusing sections if that helps.

Thanks for the great product!
Alex Thompson
Network Administrator
Westfield University
author: Alex Thompson

title: False positive alerts driving us crazy
content:
Dear Support,

Our team is receiving hundreds of false positive alerts every day. The system keeps alerting us about 'network congestion' when our bandwidth usage is actually normal. This is causing alert fatigue and we're starting to ignore legitimate alerts.

Examples of false alerts:
- 'High latency detected' when ping times are under 10ms
- 'Packet loss warning' when loss is < 0.1%
- 'Bandwidth exceeded' when we're at 40% capacity

We've tried adjusting the sensitivity settings but it doesn't seem to help. Can you please investigate this issue?

We're using the cloud version with 100 devices monitored.

Frustrated,
Rachel Kim
Network Operations Center Lead
City Hospital Network
author: Rachel Kim
